description:
'''Jonathan Julian Hopkins''' (born 15 August 1979) is an English musician and producer who writes and performs [[electronic music]]. He began his career playing keyboards for [[Imogen Heap]], and has produced but also contributed to albums by [[Brian Eno]], [[Coldplay]], [[David Holmes (musician)|David Holmes]] and others.

Hopkins composed the soundtrack for the 2010 film ''[[Monsters (2010 film)|Monsters]]'', which was nominated for an [[Ivor Novello Award]] for Best Original Score. His third studio album, ''[[Insides (album)|Insides]]'', reached No. 15 on the US [[Dance/Electronic Albums]] chart in 2009. His collaborations on ''[[Small Craft on a Milk Sea]]'' with Brian Eno and [[Leo Abrahams]] and ''[[Diamond Mine (King Creosote and Jon Hopkins album)|Diamond Mine]]'' with [[King Creosote]] both reached No. 82 on the [[UK Albums Chart]]. Both of his albums ''Diamond Mine'' (2011) and ''[[Immunity (Jon Hopkins album)|Immunity]]'' (2013) were nominated for the [[Mercury Prize]]. His fifth studio album ''[[Singularity (Jon Hopkins album)|Singularity]]'' received a [[Grammy]] nomination for Best Dance/Electronic Album in December 2018. Hopkins's sixth studio album, ''[[Music for Psychedelic Therapy]]'', was released on 12 November 2021.
